author: Josué López

text: Xenogears is the perfect ode of humanity, in so many ways, the better tale of what to expect if we reach a Kardashev  2 Level civilization. Which is very difficult. For instance the movie AD Astra is almost Kardashev 1 scale. Not even full Kardashev. We wont have characters project elemental magic, but we will certainly have advanced spaceships. The theme of religion is very present in the game. The Eldridge almost feels like a religious/ civilization carrying spaceship. At 100 kilometers long, it is an awesome idea to include in a story. Brilliant by all means... I wish I would have been there to work on Xenogears. I would love to contribute to such amazing stories. All it needs now is a sequel, a more scientifically accurate sequel. But this musical tone.... how can we ever thank Mr.Mitsuda enough? Great work on this theme..

author: Benso

text: As much as I'd love a full-fledged Xenogears remake, it's just not going to happen. Xenogears' IP is co-owned by Square Enix and MonolithSoft, which means that unless they team up for a collab project, it's not happening. It's why in World of Final Fantasy, Square had to name the very obvious portrayal of Fei's Weltall XG to avoid copyright infringement. A Xenosaga remake would be more likely, as long as Nintendo allows it, of course. It's a crying shame, too, because Xenogears is probably the best-written story I've ever seen from video games as a medium.
author: Von Armen

text: @Von Armen Although, the mech in World of FF is indeed the Xenogears version of Weltall, so calling it XG is not that wrong, also Xenoblade 2 revived the Zohar story and even had Square in the credits, so a remake nowadays is not  that impossible.
author: Brian Silva

text:
Unfortunately due to licensing rights, it will not happen. But is a remake what we want? We desperately cling to the past. And for good reason! Many of us played this game during formative years in our lives. This piece of art has shaped us into who we are today, and we long to see the story told again. 

But it won’t, and if it will, you might not like it. Different director, scenario designer, writers, music composers, etc. All there to reinterpret the original work.

Sure, Xenogears was fraught with problems, but it’s also the impact on each of our lives is real and tangible. Instead of asking for a remake, play the original again. Maybe play with a close friend or significant other. Maybe just sit and appreciate the fact that you were able to enjoy a timeless piece of art, flawed and stuck in time as it is. 

I’m so grateful that I was able to experience this piece of art and rich storytelling, which has, I believe, made an indelible mark on who I am as a human being.

text: @GAMMA XII FFVII Was still sick as Hell, even in comparison.  The main difference, however, is that Xenogears was an underbudgeted, unfinished, semi-scrapped game that was STILL a masterpiece, whereas FFVII was the "BOOM BITCHES!  Check out mah BLING!," in-your-face awesomesauce of its time, and a masterpiece.
author: Phillip Roberts

text: @Phillip Roberts Xenogears was still a better game. FFVII is overhyped.
author: GAMMA XII

text:
@GAMMA XII
I have no idea if I like FFVII because of the nostalgia factor or something, but I really only finished it like 5 years ago or so for the first time. Classed it among my top 2 games. Then played FF:Tactics, and goddammit that game is good, I placed it even higher. Then I played Chrono Cross, and I placed it even higher. And 2 (or 3?) years ago I played Xenogears for the first time... and it instantly became my favorite game of all time! And it's unfinished. I like FF8, a LOT, but I would take Xenogears over FF8 any day, so fuck you Square for over-prioritizing FF8 and completely leaving Xenogears on the side. (I don't know what it is with older games, but any new game I play isn't better than the old games I recently play. I started FFX as well recently and it's also a fucking masterpiece, no matter what people say beacuse of Tidus who cares. And it's not because of the nostalgia factor for me, I'm just playing them right now, didn't play them when I was a kid, still better story than most recent games I don't get it)
My list right now is Xenogears>Chrono Cross>FF Tactis>FFVII,VI,X, Square games in general.
So I would prioritize a Xenogears remake over ANYTHING. Simply by reading the first few sentences when the "book" part of CD2 began I saw SO MUCH potential.
Like, I have a VERY APPROXIMATE memory of it starting along the lines of "We went through that factory. Mid-way we saw some rockets standing there and we questionned their purpose. Then we reached the end and launched the bio-[whatever it was]. Suddenly humans all over the planet started randomly turning into [those brown modified thingies]." And I was like "HOLD UP!!! You just skipped what could easily be more than an hour/an hour and a half of gaming in 4 sentences!!! No!!!!!!! What is happening!" You could imagine so much through all those texts written, that they couldn't program because Square didn't leave them the time and money (come on, all that because they decided to trust FFVIII (8) =\ Fuck you just for that Square)
Anyway, so much potential... XG needs a remake Q.Q Too bad we probably won't have one, ever, because of rights over the game being completely discrete, or Square owning too much and the creators at Monolithe now owning nothing, or I don't even remember.
Oh but to your comment saying FFVII is shit compared to XG, I still get a bigger nostalgia overdrive from FFVII's music than from XG's, and it's still a game with a great atmosphere and lovable characters, compared to XG having its INCREDIBLE story as a main asset (and since I love story more than anything, I obviously would place XG as n°1).
Why am I ranting? I don't know. I'm just still amazed by the power all those old games have (I almost said "old Square games" but in the end the "Square" Square staff did more bad than good to XG xD [ok they gave the money so XG would've never existed without them, but if the making staff found another publisher/developer thingy whatever it's called then maybe......])
[Edit : By the way I don't even remember where I take these informations from, the fact that Square was only the publisher and the main staff aren't really the ones at Square who were working on the FFs and stuff... I just remember I heard that somewhere, so I may be wrong, my research is old, it's been like 3 years now so I won't even be able to quote my sources]

+Lucas Kazama The dumbass thing was to create all those stupid new characters in the FF7 project compilation. FF7 wasn't created to have a continuation in the first place.
I won't even comment how horrible it seems the remake will be (or at the very least, completely different from the original game and closer to the compilation project), but I at least agree with the guy that created this thread about the fact that Xenogears is the only rpg that really deserves a remake. In general, I prefer when a company focus on creating new games instead seeking easy money with their past glories, but Xenogears is almost an unfinished game (FF8 fault, just the truth, and it wasn't for the best). This game really deserves to be remade.

The interesting part is that Xenogears is actually FF 7.In the end It was judged too dark by directors, so a new FF7 game has been made and because they didn't wanted to throw all the work for the old FF 7 to the trash, they named it Xenogears and released it as well.

Conclusion : If FF 7 hasn't been judged too dark back then, We would have a Xenogears remake in development today.

text:
On a gameplay standpoint, the second disk was a disaster. But the story was actually enhanced with the different pacing and the final chance to wander around the world at the very end. I grinded for 15 hours to save Elly before going within Deus.

After beating the game, it took my heart which FF8 held previously. I grew up with FF8, so it should show just how amazing XG is to me.
Replaying is of top priority as soon as I get my guides ready for a complete and perfect playthrough.

text: The fact that Mario was the reason why jumping was added isn't really relevant. Regardless of the reasons behind it, jumping WAS implemented, and implemented well. It allowed the player to traverse multiple layers/floors in dungeons without having to climb a flight of stairs every time, among other things. It also made it easier to avoid battles (theoretically you could do the same in Chrono Trigger, but in practice not really because some enemies are almost impossible to avoid).

And they have the clear right to, because this game proves it's epicness which few games can do actually. There are many awesome games today, but let me tell you few of them can remain remembered that good and make it famous even after more than a decade! Such a classic...

author: RadicalDreamer17

text:
@DarkSeraphim02 
As a girl, I also would have liked more from the XG women. Because really... if they're not kids, they're either fangirls/dead/housewives/DID or a puppet (Miang is a good villain, she manipulates everyone... but she just does everything a machine tells her to do, not what she wants to do), no matter how capable they actually are. It's kinda funny really because even Margie talks about it in the game : "Men are so selfish... (...) They treat women like we are weaklings".

author: R Soto

text: This game has one of the best soundtracks EVER. This music fit perfectly with the Tower of Babel dungeon. I loved the whole idea of exploring a gigantic ancient ruin.  The scale of it was amazing and this song only accented the whole thing.
author: Josh S.

text:
I loved how this song would repeat endlessly on disc 2, with that pendant swinging back and forth while the story was told. 

It also made the never-ending Tower of Babel enjoyable - i'm sure i'd have hated that dungeon with a lesser BG track.

What a game..
author: Goldsac

text: This game was not released in the Uk so i don;'t know the story line, plus we only got Xenosaga ep. 2. Though i love the music, i am hoping to do composition for game/anime in the future.

author: raignsk

text: You missed out on alot. Good thing you are playing them now.
author: Arden Meissner

text:
Its sad that now I'm a huge RPG gamer, but back then I skipped all these wonderful games. All I had in my mind was GT, Crash Bandicoot and Winning Eleven :(

I never played Xenogears, Chrono Cross, Suikoden games on PS1, Vagrant Story... not even FF VII (until recently when one of my friends gave me the game as a gift). In true sense, FFX was my first RPG that I finished till the end, and I was hooked afterwards.
author: jubailblast

text: I actually just beat it again the other day. It makes a little more sense now...
author: DoctorAtomic1111

text:
Hit the Wiki on the story, I got confused myself.

Briefly both man and machine are needed to bring 'Deus' back to life, hence, humans are needed in the Gears.

Fei's true power is Id, and Id is not controllable.  Only when all three of Fei's personalities unite does Grahf want to take over Fei's body.  Which he fails in doing so.
author: Christopher Branca

text: Really? So then tell me why is it that in this game, they have all this technology to do all this insane stuff, yet they still need humans for gears? And why doesn't Grahf just unleash Fei's true power himself? Now that's laughable.
author: DoctorAtomic1111

text: Xenogears changed my life! and I'm thankful for it, the best game of all time for me
